chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Firearm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Motion Hearing exhibits from 09-22-2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: 793
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Back on the record:
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

PSI ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Defendant remanded pending sentencing.

10:50 a.m.  Jury panel released and instructed to return to Jury Management.
Trial is vacated from the court's calendar.
